definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: He was a silver-tongued orator who convinced many people to support him.
sentences.chinese: 他是个能言善辩的演说家，能赢得很多人的支持。

sentences.english: Many believe that a politician has to be silver-tongued.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为政客必须要能言善辩。

sentences.english: Obama is indeed eloquent, but diplomacy can not just empty words.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的确能言善辩，但外交上不能光说空话。

definition: can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
lit. to have a tongue like a reed (idiom)/fig. to have a glib tongue
eloquent and fluent speaker (idiom); grandiloquence/the gift of the gab
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to have a silver tongue/to have the gift of the gab
pinyin: san1 cun4 bu4 lan4 zhi1 she2

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话
